staticdocs
  • Home
  • Reference
  • Articles

Build complete static documentation for a package.

Usage

build_site(pkg = ".", path = "docs", examples = TRUE,
  run_dont_run = FALSE, templates_path = "inst/staticdocs/templates",
  assets_path = "inst/staticdocs/assets", mathjax = TRUE,
  launch = interactive(), seed = 1014)

Arguments

pkg
Path to package source.
path
Output path.
examples
Run examples?
run_dont_run
Run examples that are surrounded in \dontrun?
templates_path
Path in which to look for templates. If this doesn't exist will look next in pkg/inst/staticdocs/templates, then in staticdocs itself.
assets_path
Path in which to look for assets files. If this doesn't exist, will use files built into staticdocs.
mathjax
Use mathjax to render math symbols?
launch
If TRUE, will open freshly generated site in web browser.
seed
Seed used to initialize so that random examples are reproducible.

Description

build_site calls init_site(), build_site(), build_home(), and build_reference. See the individual documentation for how the code works.

Examples

## Not run: ------------------------------------
# build_site()
## ---------------------------------------------
